intro: Eurylepis bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and a showy inflorescence called a cyathium, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in drought-tolerant gardens.
